definitions.title: 1. n.pr.m.
definitions.body: 11th son of Joktan Ge 10:29 (J) = 1Ch 1:23; LXX Ou)feir, )Wfeir, name of an Arabian tribe, vid. Ge 10:30 & Di.

definitions.title: 2. n.pr.loc.
definitions.body: (land or city S. or SE. fr. Palestine, exact position unknown, cf. infr.; LXX Swfhra, Swfeira, Soufeir, etc.; Job 28:16 )Wfeir AC, cf. 1Ki 22:49 A )Wfeirde, B om.) place whither Sol.'s ships went fr. Ezion Geber, bringing thence gold 1Ki 9:28—cf. 1Ki 22:49—2Ch 8:18; gold, almug- (sandal-?) wood & gems 2Ch 10:11, 2Ch 10:11, cf. 2Ch 9:10; prob. 1Ki 10:22 ref. to same ships; they came once in three years with gold, silver, ivory, apes & peacocks (all fr. Ophir ?); 2Ch 9:21 makes these ships go to Tarshish (but on Tarshish-ships, i.e. large, sea-going vessels, merchantmen, v. 1Ki 22:49 & sub [[תַּרְשִׁישׁ]]).
characteristic of fine gold (poet. & late) ´[[זְהַב א]] 1Ch 29:4; ´[[כֶּתֶם א]] Is 13:12, Job 28:16, Ps 45:10.
hence for fine gold itself Job 22:24 (‖[[בֶּחֶר]]).—(If

, then southern, prob. south-eastern, Arabia (cf. Di Ge 10:29) furnished the gold; and other articles, which point farther E. (e.g. to India, toward which the words [[קוֹפִים]] apes & [[תֻּכִּיִּים]] peacocks seem to lead), were either brought to Ophir by traders, & so found there by Sol.'s men, or were found elsewhere by the latter, whose cruise may have taken them beyond Ophir, the name of Ophir alone, as source of gold-supply, being preserved. If (less likely)
are not the same, the only data for determining loc. of

are the articles brought, & one may look toward India, Ceylon or other islands, or even lower Africa. Particular theories have as yet no adequate support; e.g. (a) old city Supara, or Uppara, in the region of Goa, Malabar coast (cf. LXX supr.

; form with S said on Copt. authority to denote India, v. Jablonskii:Opusc. ed. te Water i. 337; cf. also Jos:Ant. viii. 6. 4; in that case its use by LXX may indicate a theory of the location of Ophir); (b) peninsula Malacca; (c) island Sumatra; (d) Sofâla, with city Zimbabye (SE. Africa); (e) west coast of Arabia (where gold & silver formerly found), etc. On these & other theories, v. Di Ge 10:29 Ri:HWB, Herzog, Smith:Dict. Bib.; cf. Glaser:Skizze ii. 367 ff.)
